title: Newtons third law - hammer and nail

content.question: A hammer drives a nail into a piece of wood that is at rest. At the instant shown, the hammer is in contact with the nail and the nail is accelerating downward. Which of the following claims correctly compares the magnitudes of the forces between the hammer, nail, and wood at this instant?

choices.label: The magnitude of the force that the hammer exerts on the nail is equal to the magnitude of the force that the nail exerts on the hammer.
The magnitude of the force that the wood exerts on the nail is equal to the magnitude of the force that the hammer exerts on the nail.
The magnitude of the force that the hammer exerts on the nail is equal to the magnitude of the force that the nail exerts on the wood.
The magnitude of the force that the nail exerts on the hammer is equal to the force that the wood exerts on the nail.

content.answer: The magnitude of the force that the hammer exerts on the nail is equal to the magnitude of the force that the nail exerts on the hammer.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
